title.native: SK∞ エスケーエイト EXTRA PART

description:
Original video animation for SK∞ (Sk8 the Infinity).

Four slice-of-life omnibus stories.

- The Rain and a Cat, Soda Ice Cream from the Convenience Store One Sunday, Reki, Langa, and Miya head out to the skatepark as usual when a squall suddenly hits them. They head back to Reki’s place and start playing Karuta, a Japanese card game they find!?

- Becoming Really Serious About Things In the past, Sakurayashiki and Nanjo had spent their high school days in relative obscurity. These two always had butt heads and competed, but what lies ahead for them from all this competition?

- Morning Routine This story unravels the mystery surrounding Ainosuke and Kikuchi’s everyday life. It closes in on their secret moments, crossovers, and a moment beyond that draws closer.

- Hiromi, Do Your Best! Shadow is an anti-hero at night, but this is his three-part slice-of-life flash story highlighting his noble and kind personality as he works hard at a flower shop during the day.

(Source: Aniplex USA)

Premiered in theaters on 01/24/2025. The home video was released on 03/19/2025.
synonyms: SK∞ エスケーエイト OVA EXTRA PART

alternative: Cherry Blossom (チェリーブロッサム)

node.description:
Hiroko Utsumi is a Japanese director and animator.

Utsumi is best known for her work with [Kyoto Animation](https://anilist.co/studio/2/), particularly as the original director of [Free!](https://anilist.co/anime/18507/), and for her later work at [MAPPA](https://anilist.co/studio/569/), where she directed [Banana Fish](https://anilist.co/anime/100388/). She is a graduate of the Osaka Municipal College of Design.

(Source: Wikipedia)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/ichirou_o)

Waseda University graduate. Best known as the co-creator of [Code Geass](https://anilist.co/anime/1575/).
She was part of [Kyoto Animation](https://anilist.co/studio/2/) from 2001 to 2018, but has since gone freelance.

Hiroko Utsumi is a Japanese director and animator.

Utsumi is best known for her work with [Kyoto Animation](https://anilist.co/studio/2/), particularly as the original director of [Free!](https://anilist.co/anime/18507/), and for her later work at [MAPPA](https://anilist.co/studio/569/), where she directed [Banana Fish](https://anilist.co/anime/100388/). She is a graduate of the Osaka Municipal College of Design.

(Source: Wikipedia)
**Honami Yamagishi** is a Japanese editor, who provides editing assistance to various works.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/Sunma47) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/三間雅文)

One of the industry's most prolific sound directors, having worked on more than 300 productions.

After having graduated college, Mima joined Magic Capsule, a sound production company ran by his relative [Susumu Aketagawa](https://anilist.co/staff/120062/). In 1986, he debuted as a sound director on [MD Geist](https://anilist.co/anime/1285/MD-Geist/). He left Magic Capsule in 1996, and later joined Techno Sound. In 2004, he became the studio's representative director.

__[Twitter](https://twitter.com/bell_yot)__

__Andou Youta__ is a Japanese CG director.

__[Profile (Lantis)](https://www.lantis.jp/artist/Void_Chords/bio.html) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/RyoTakahashi111)__

__Ryo Takashi__, alternatively known as Void_Chords, is a Japanese composer, arranger, music producer, bassist and DJ. He also works with the doujin group FELT under the alias Maurits "ZEN" Cornelis.

**[SOUND BOX Profile (JP)](http://www.sound-box.jp/information/shizuo_k.html)** | **[SOUND BOX Profile (EN)](http://www.sound-box.jp/english/information/shizuo_k.html)**

Shizuo Kurahashi is a Japanese sound effects editor. He worked as an editor at the Nikkatsu filming studio. After that he started his sound career in ToyoOnkyo. 

He established his own company SOUND BOX in 1988. Since 1983, when the dolby stereo system got popular in Japan - he has been creating filmsounds. He has edited and arranged sounds for over 1000 works.

[Instagram](https://Instagram.com/rodrigoomartim/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/rodrigo_martim)

Rodrigo Martim is a Brazilian actor, voice actor and dubbing director. He currently directs at the DuBrasil studio.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/HEYSUEZO) | [LinkedIn](https://www.linkedin.com/in/jallenlord/)

Affiliated with [Crunchyroll](https://anilist.co/studio/6421) as an ADR Director.
